notesStmt.note: Folio 2r & 2v is a modern paper. Contains a description of the manuscript in Latin. Avraham ben Aharon: inscribed, folio 1v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Midrash Aba Orion (aka Midrash Aba Gurion) on the book of Esther.

collation.p: 2 quires of 8 leaves each and 2 additional folios at the beginning and at the end. Catchwords at the end of a quire.

binding.p: Post-1600. Light brown leather, blind-tooled. Spine title: 'Abba Urian. Comm. in Estheram. Mus. Brit. Jure Empt. 15,402. Plut.' Boxed.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Prince Augustus Frederick (b. 1773, d. 1843), Duke of Sussex: his armorial book-plate, stuck to the inner upper cover; his sale 18 January 1845: inscribed ([19v]), lot 1, purchased by the British Museum through Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849).
